result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan R Bodensteiner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: Costs in 15CM939 shall be paid as a condition of probation in this case.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall have no contact with Mary Kay or Robert B. unless as approved by the probation agent.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and make arrangements within 3 days with the Washington County Sheriffs Department.

Defendant shall take medication as prescribed. 

Defendant shall comply with Chapter 51 orders.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: Count 1

miscConds.notes: All conditions of probation in Count 1 are inclusive of Count 3.

records.addlTxt: Notice of hearing dated 10/9/17; not deliverable as addressed
Letter received from Wisconsin Department of Corrections
Removed Probation Review Hearing from 11-14-17 due to full payment being made per probation agent.
Probation review hearing on November 14, 2017 at 02:45 pm.

Def appeared in person.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Clerk: EZ.  State indicates costs due are not paid.  Defendant states he has paid the amounts due. State indicates the receipts indicate payment to 15CM939.  State indicates that restitution would be paid to the Department of Corrections.  Defendant's father appears-Robert B.  Defendant's agent is through Milwaukee Co.  Robert B. states the defendant paid half of the restitution and was going to pay the other half at next visit.  State will follow up with the agent.  Defendant states will make full payment of restitution before the next hearing.  Probation review hearing scheduled for November 14, 2017 at 02:45 pm.
Probation review hearing on October 27, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
